conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D render: walls have height and visible thickness, multiple faces per wall are shown, angled/isometric viewpoint, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Convincing 3D extrusion with readable corners, clear floor/wall separation, and clean cutaway; minor simplification at some wall junctions/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: bedroom top-left, living/dining center-left, kitchen right, toilet upper-right/center, balcony bottom-left, entry/foyer bottom-right. Some proportional/partition details (especially around foyer/utility/kitchen segmentation) appear simplified compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major elements present and placed logically: bed in bedroom, sofa and dining table in living/dining, kitchen appliances/cabinets, and bathroom fixtures. Minor omissions/simplifications (e.g., limited cabinetry/utility detailing).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are visually distinct, interior is well-lit and readable, consistent materials, clean background with no UI/text contamination. Slight ambiguity in a couple of doorway/window placements due to simplified modeling.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion simplification around the right-side service/foyer/utility area versus the 2D plan (partitioning and room extents not perfectly matched).
Some door/window locations and opening proportions are not clearly verifiable or appear simplified relative to the 2D plan.

summary: A true, clean cutaway 3D conversion with strong spatial readability and largely faithful room layout, with minor right-side partitioning and opening-placement simplifications versus the 2D plan.
